title: Ticket #3623: DAGMan doesn't do the right thing when submit of a nested subDAG fails
description:
When a nested dag is submitted with a nonexistent DAG file, DAGman does not mark the job as failed (moving it to STATUS_ERROR). Instead it stays in STATUS_READY, not moved to STATUS_SUBMITTED, and is moved out of readyQ. Then DAGMan will be in a state where it cannot move forward, and fail with an obscure and unhelpful error message: 
ERROR: DAG finished but not all nodes are complete -- checking for a cycle...
... ERROR: no cycle found; unknown error condition
Fix DAGMan so that it marks a job that fails in such a manner to be an error.
remarks:
2013-May-14 12:31:26 by nwp:
We have the following in the dagman.out file: 
04/22/13 14:08:10 Submitting Condor Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 job(s)...
04/22/13 14:08:10 submitting: condor_submit -a dag_node_name' '=' '12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 -a +DAGManJobId' '=' '8975512 -a DAGManJobId' '=' '8975512 -a submit_event_notes' '=' 'DAG' 'Node:' '12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 -a macroihopecache' '=' 'H1L1-RINCA_FIRST_RINGDOWN_QF_LOG_B_INJ_CAT_2_VETO-931035296-1524214.cache -a macrovetosegmentsname' '=' 'VETO_CAT2_CUMULATIVE -a macrovetosegments' '=' '/home/pbaker/S6_runs/s6a/931035296-935798487/segments/H1L1V1-VETOTIME_CAT_2-931035296-4763191.xml -a macroinstruments' '=' 'H1,L1,V1 -a DAG_STATUS' '=' '2 -a FAILED_COUNT' '=' '1 -a +DAGParentNodeNames' '=' '"" -a +KeepClaimIdle' '=' '20 cbc_ripedown_rerun.simulation.thinca_to_coinc.sub
04/22/13 14:08:10 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for Condor Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 (8981096.0.0)
04/22/13 14:08:23 Event: ULOG_EXECUTE for Condor Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 (8981096.0.0)
04/22/13 14:08:23 Event: ULOG_IMAGE_SIZE for Condor Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 (8981096.0.0)
04/22/13 14:08:23 Event: ULOG_JOB_TERMINATED for Condor Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 (8981096.0.0)
04/22/13 14:08:23 Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 job proc (8981096.0.0) completed successfully.
04/22/13 14:08:23 Node 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693 job completed
At the end, we have the following, when DAGMan errors out and dumps the DAG: 
04/22/13 15:10:45 ERROR: DAG finished but not all nodes are complete -- checking for a cycle...
04/22/13 15:10:45 ... ERROR: no cycle found; unknown error condition
04/22/13 15:10:45 ---------------------- Job ----------------------
04/22/13 15:10:45       Node Name: 12e06b192be3df114c663d6b00cab693
04/22/13 15:10:45            Noop: false
04/22/13 15:10:45          NodeID: 0
04/22/13 15:10:45     Node Status: STATUS_DONE
04/22/13 15:10:45 Node return val: -1
04/22/13 15:10:45 Job Submit File: cbc_ripedown_rerun.simulation.thinca_to_coinc.sub
04/22/13 15:10:45   Condor Job ID: [not yet submitted]
04/22/13 15:10:45       Q_PARENTS: <END>
04/22/13 15:10:45       Q_WAITING: <END>
04/22/13 15:10:45      Q_CHILDREN: 2098110567c13d76d957bc1543fab25b, <END>
So DAGMan sees the job finishing successfully, but does not record the return value?

I see that the last message comes after the DAG tries to read the rescue DAG, successfully runs a few jobs, then barfs with "unknown error condition", and fails. Probably the Node return value is not set in a rescue DAG, so this is a red herring.

2013-May-14 12:41:31 by wenger:
Do you have the original DAG file, rescue DAG(s), etc., involved in this?

BTW, as I recall the code that decides when the DAG is "finished" is more complicated than one might expect. I had to mess with that when I added final nodes, and unfortunately probably made it even more complicated (although I did try to do some cleaning up).

2013-May-14 13:01:54 by wenger:
I think the original email is a little misleading -- when DAGMan hits this error, I think it dumps info about all of the node jobs -- so the one that's in the email is not necessarily part of the problem. Further down there are some jobs with STATUS_READY instead of STATUS_DONE -- so it looks like the problem is in the (kind of tricky) code that decides when the DAG is finished.

2013-May-14 13:08:47 by wenger:
More info from the emails: 

      From: Paul T Baker <paultbaker@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: [CondorLIGO] [DASWG] Re: pipedown reruns
Date: April 23, 2013 11:19:08 AM EDT
To: "Peter F. Couvares" <pfcouvar@syr.edu>

At one point a missing file caused a failure. I put the file in the right place and the rescue dag ran until `completion'. I've included that rescue dag and the rescue dag made at the end. I'll try running that rescue dag now... I don't know why I didn't try yesterday. 

      From: Paul T Baker <paultbaker@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: [CondorLIGO] [DASWG] Re: pipedown reruns
Date: April 23, 2013 11:41:52 AM EDT
To: "Peter F. Couvares" <pfcouvar@syr.edu>
Cc: "cdcapano@syr.edu" <cdcapano@syr.edu>

digging a little deeper I may have found the problem: 04/23/13 08:19:57 ERROR: condor_submit_dag -no_submit failed for node 2ced337eabcc4b7754310fd1d0955ed8. 04/23/13 08:19:57 Recursive submit command: <condor_submit_dag -no_submit -update_submit -dagman /usr/bin/condor_dagman -autorescue 1 cbc_ripedown_rerun_mvsc_FULL_DATA_CAT_2_VETO_n2000_l65_s14_c6.dag> 04/23/13 08:19:57 ERROR: condor_submit_dag -no_submit failed on DAG file cbc_ripedown_rerun_mvsc_FULL_DATA_CAT_2_VETO_n2000_l65_s14_c6.dag.

running mvsc_dag as /bin/true it never generates the MVSC sub dags. So those 4 dags are never made, and their child jobs will never be run. Why the dag didn't crash and burn in a way I'm familiar with, I still don't know.

2013-May-14 16:17:01 by nwp:
Looks like the job enters a kind of limbo: 
3827         if ( runSubmitDag( *_submitDagDeepOpts, node->GetDagFile(),
3828                     node->GetDirectory(), isRetry ) != 0 ) {
3829             debug_printf( DEBUG_QUIET,
3830                         "ERROR: condor_submit_dag -no_submit failed "
3831                         "for node %s.\n", node->GetJobName() );
3832                 // Hmm -- should this be a node failure, since it probably
3833                 // won't work on retry?  wenger 2010-03-26
3834             if( node->_hasNodePriority && node->_nodePriority < _submitDagDeepOpts->priority ){
3835                 swap_priorities(node,_submitDagDeepOpts);
3836             }
3837             return SUBMIT_RESULT_NO_SUBMIT;
3838         }
and 
1585
1586             } else if ( submit_result == SUBMIT_RESULT_NO_SUBMIT ) {
1587                 // No op.
1588
1589             } else {
These are in src/condor_dagman/dag.cpp

2013-May-14 16:19:11 by nwp:
Should have said that this code was from master, not 7.8

2013-May-15 09:41:26 by nwp:
As I posted to the ligo list the following dag shows the problem 
subdag external 0 does-not-exist.dag

2013-May-15 17:38:08 by wenger:
Nathan -- looks good, go ahead and merge...

2013-May-20 16:19:34 by wenger:
Changed the title to hopefully better reflect the bug -- if the nested subDAG runs but fails, it didn't trigger this problem...
